newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's Dunaferr takes up 3 bln forint loan.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's Dunaferr takes up 3 bln forint loan.

text.p: Hungarian steel mill Dunaferr Rt on Monday signed a loan agreement to take up a five-year syndicated loan worth three billion forints from a bank consortium, co-lead manager CIB Hungaria Rt said.
The loan, provided partly in forints and partly in hard currency, aims at financing the reconstruction of the blast furnace, it said in a statement.
The loan, jointly organised by CIB Hungaria Bank Rt and OTP Bank Rt, was extended by a consortium of four Hungarian and one foreign banks.
It has an interest rate 0.7 percent above the base rate of the National Bank of Hungary, now 21 percent, and above the London Interbank Offered Rates (LIBOR), the statement added.
